extraction_metadata.extraction_focus: Alpaca MCP Server implementation details for integration

sources.context: Official Alpaca MCP Server GitHub repository - Primary implementation source

key_facts.fact: Python-based server implementing Model Context Protocol standard
key_facts.details: Architecture consists of: MCP Server Component (server.py), Configuration Management (config.py), CLI Interface (cli.py), Helper Functions (helper.py)
key_facts.quote: The server implements the Model Context Protocol standard, exposing trading functionality as tools that LLMs can discover and invoke.

key_facts.fact: Multi-asset support across stocks, crypto, and options
key_facts.details: Stocks & ETFs: Full trading capabilities including market, limit, stop, stop-limit, and trailing-stop orders. Cryptocurrencies: Market, limit, and stop-limit orders with GTC/IOC time-in-force options. Options: Single-leg and multi-leg strategies (spreads, straddles, etc.) with Greeks analysis. Market Data: Real-time quotes, historical bars, trades, and comprehensive snapshots
key_facts.exact_quote: The MCP server enables trading and analysis across multiple asset classes: Stocks & ETFs, Cryptocurrencies, Options, Market Data

key_facts.details: get_account_info(), get_all_positions(), get_open_position(symbol), get_portfolio_history(), close_position(), close_all_positions()
key_facts.technical_note: View balance, margin, account status, positions, P/L over time, partial/full liquidation

key_facts.fact: Comprehensive market data access across asset classes
key_facts.details: Stock Data: Bars, quotes, trades, latest data with configurable timeframes (1Min to 1Month). Crypto Data: Historical bars, quotes, trades, orderbooks. Options Data: Contract search, Greeks, implied volatility, snapshots. Market Status: Clock information, calendar, corporate actions
place_stock_order(), place_crypto_order(), place_option_order(), get_orders(), cancel_all_orders(), cancel_order_by_id()
key_facts.technical_note: Supports market, limit, stop, stop-limit, trailing-stop orders for stocks; crypto-specific orders with quantity/notional sizing; single/multi-leg options strategies

key_facts.details: create_watchlist(), get_watchlists(), update_watchlist_by_id(), add_asset_to_watchlist_by_id(), remove_asset_from_watchlist_by_id()
get_asset(), get_all_assets() with filtering by status, class, exchange, attributes
get_option_contracts() with expiration/strike filtering, get_option_latest_quote(), get_option_snapshot() with Greeks, exercise_options_position()
Automatically configures API keys and client settings with guided prompts

key_facts.code_example:
git clone https://github.com/alpacahq/alpaca-mcp-server.git
cd alpaca-mcp-server
python3 install.py
key_facts.details: Sets up virtual environment, creates .env file, and configures MCP clients
Suitable for remote hosting and containerized environments
Users can install directly from Cursor Directory by clicking 'Add to Cursor', then entering API credentials

key_facts.fact: JSON configuration for Claude Desktop using uvx

key_facts.details: Python 3.10+, uv package manager, Alpaca Trading API keys (free paper trading available), MCP client (Claude Desktop, Cursor, VS Code, etc.), Terminal/Command Prompt access

key_facts.code_example:
ALPACA_API_KEY = "your_alpaca_api_key"
ALPACA_SECRET_KEY = "your_alpaca_secret_key"
ALPACA_PAPER_TRADE = True
TRADE_API_URL = None
TRADE_API_WSS = None
DATA_API_URL = None
STREAM_DATA_WSS = None
key_facts.technical_note: For live trading, set ALPACA_PAPER_TRADE = False and update both .env file and MCP client configuration JSON (client config takes precedence)

examples: Buy 5 shares of AAPL at market price
Sell 5 shares of TSLA with a limit price of $300
Liquidate my entire position in GOOGL
Close 10% of my position in NVDA
Show me available option contracts for AAPL expiring next month
Place a bull call spread using AAPL June 6th options: $190 and $200 strikes
Get the Greeks for TSLA250620P00500000 option
Show me AAPL's daily price history for the last 5 trading days
Get a comprehensive stock snapshot for AAPL
Compare market snapshots for TSLA, NVDA, and MSFT
Show me recent cash dividends for AAPL, MSFT, GOOGL
Place a market order to buy 0.01 ETH/USD
Place a limit order to sell 0.01 BTC/USD at $110,000

key_facts.code_example:
alpaca-mcp-server/
├── src/alpaca_mcp_server/
│   ├── __init__.py
│   ├── cli.py           (Command-line interface)
│   ├── config.py        (Configuration management)
│   ├── helper.py        (Helper functions)
│   └── server.py        (MCP server implementation)
├── .env.example         (Environment template)
├── Dockerfile           (Docker configuration)
├── pyproject.toml       (Package configuration)
├── requirements.txt     (Python dependencies)
└── install.py          (Installation script)

key_facts.details: Communicates with Alpaca's Trading API and Data API endpoints, supporting: Paper trading mode (default, risk-free), Live trading mode (real funds), Multiple account switching, Real-time and historical data feeds

key_facts.fact: Latest 15-minute market data requires 'Algo Trader Plus Plan'
key_facts.technical_note: Data subscription level affects access to real-time data

key_facts.fact: Currently limited to watchlists created via Trading API (not web interface)
Greeks calculated from market data; availability depends on data subscription level
Paper trading account recommended for testing before live trading
Both server and client installation/configuration needed
MIT License (open source, freely usable with attribution)
MCP server acts as bridge between AI interfaces and trading capabilities
key_facts.exact_quote: An MCP server itself acts as a bridge between the MCP client (AI interfaces) and the capabilities.

key_facts.fact: Server exposes 43 functions across multiple categories
key_facts.categories: Account & Portfolio, Market Data, Trading Operations, Data Management

key_facts.fact: Multiple client support with local and remote options
key_facts.important_note: Remote hosting is currently unavailable; self-hosting is required for remote deployments

key_facts.fact: System requirements identical to GitHub source
key_facts.details: Python 3.10+, uv package manager, Terminal access, Alpaca API keys (paper trading available), MCP client application

key_facts.technical_note: Alpaca API keys must be linked to correct account type (live or paper)

key_facts.exact_quote: Review and confirm orders directly on your Alpaca dashboard. You can do this in real time to ensure accuracy before or after submitting trades.
Remote deployment should include HTTPS or TLS for encrypted communication and a reliable token based authentication method to protect credentials

key_facts.fact: Access to data without autonomous execution
key_facts.details: Real-time market data and portfolio details accessible for human decision making
Single interface for equities, ETFs, crypto, and options
Begin with natural language prompts, advancing to code-based optimization

key_facts.exact_quote: Insights generated by our MCP server and connected AI agents are for educational and informational purposes only and should not be taken as investment advice.

key_facts.details: Trading operations through AI interfaces without traditional coding

key_facts.fact: Natural language to structured API translation
key_facts.details: Integrates with popular AI platforms to translate natural language prompts into structured API requests

Execute trades in fractional equities, cryptocurrencies, ETFs, and multi-leg options (spreads, condors). Full visibility with 'every prompt, parameter, and order payload' viewable before market execution
key_facts.exact_quote: Full visibility into AI-driven trades with every prompt, parameter, and order payload viewable before market execution

key_facts.details: Live and historical market data retrieval, Portfolio P&L analysis, Corporate actions information, Real-time pricing across supported asset classes
Paper trading with simulated $100K funds and real market data. Live trading activation by updating API keys
No minimum deposit, Free account creation available, Paper and live trading both supported
Step-by-step configuration for each supported platform in official GitHub repository (alpacahq/alpaca-mcp-server)

sources.context: Guide on AI agent integration with Alpaca

key_facts.details: References Model Context Protocol implementation by GitHub user tedlikeskix that enables LLMs like Claude to interact with Alpaca's Trading API
key_facts.capability: Trades and market data queries through natural language without requiring traditional coding
key_facts.exact_quote: Trade stocks, check balances, and fetch data via chat with context memory and dynamic prompts

key_facts.details: Using ChatGPT 3.5, Alpaca's API, and Zapier integration enables automated, zero-code stock trading bot by analyzing data from stock news RSS feed
key_facts.benefits: Rapid prototyping and natural language command execution

key_facts.exact_quote: Build a no-code AI assistant that researches and understands stock trading commands and routes them to Alpaca using Zapier Agents
Set up a zero-code AI trading bot using TAAPI for technical analysis combined with ChatGPT for analysis and Alpaca for execution
NLPs, MCPs, AI Agents, and LLMs aren't perfect and can misinterpret commands

key_facts.details: Math limitations in some LLMs affect backtesting accuracy
Risk logic failures without proper guardrails can lead to unintended trades
API rate limits can affect high-frequency operations
Test all functionality in paper trading environment before live execution
Implement manual confirmation steps for trade execution

key_facts.fact: Use limit orders and cap position sizes
key_facts.details: Implement risk controls through order types and position sizing
Comprehensive testing required before deploying new trading commands

deployment_options.use_case: Direct installation in Cursor, VS Code, PyCharm

security_considerations: API keys stored in environment variables
integration_best_practices: Use limit orders and position size caps
Monitor all executions in real-time via dashboard
Implement proper error handling for API failures
